text:
There is so much value in
just taking the information

that is readily available
inside of your organization

and making it easier to use
and find and consume, that
I would encourage people

to not think too much about
it and just start there.
I believe that it's important
to have a robust data strategy for AI
because it helps

with data implementation
creates a framework for us
to foster innovation
and also to implement safe AI policies.
By embracing generative AI,

we have allowed our customers
to make better informed and
faster decisions on providing patient care.

And if you think about it
as an ecosystem, you do have

to choose a provider like
AWS to help you build out

that ecosystem because
you just can't do it
in a one-off silo.

And if you do so, you'll
tackle it systematically
and you'll be surprised at the
impact you'll be able to have.

Having data on AWS has supported
Strides journey in AI

because ever since 2018
we've housed our data
infrastructure on AWS services.
And through that it's really helped

with seamless deployments
from our engineering team

and also it helps with AI
research and development.

We've chosen AWS Bedrock
as our ultimate product to use
for our generative AI interface

because it's simply the
best product in the market.
GenAI is very exciting for us
because think about content curation
and packaging and distribution.

Certainly there's opportunities
to further personalize
and do that at speed.

We're going to see
where that all takes us,

but it starts with getting
the data assets right,

which includes the data
governance side as well
as the technical side of data management.

And then once again, if you
do that, the sky's the limit.
